title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

2 points; both points must be earned from the same row.

Identification (1 point) | Reasoning (1 point)

· DNA has a (negative) charge. | DNA moves toward the positive/oppositely charged pole.

· DNA can be different sizes. | (Different size DNA fragments) move at different rates.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

2 points; both points must be earned from the same row.

Identification (1 point) | Reasoning (1 point)

· DNA has a (negative) charge. | DNA moves toward the positive/oppositely charged pole.

· DNA can be different sizes. | (Different size DNA fragments) move at different rates.

The student response earns one of the following points:

2 points; both points must be earned from the same row.

Identification (1 point) | Reasoning (1 point)

· DNA has a (negative) charge. | DNA moves toward the positive/oppositely charged pole.

· DNA can be different sizes. | (Different size DNA fragments) move at different rates.

The student response earns two of the following points:

2 points; both points must be earned from the same row.

Identification (1 point) | Reasoning (1 point)

· DNA has a (negative) charge. | DNA moves toward the positive/oppositely charged pole.

· DNA can be different sizes. | (Different size DNA fragments) move at different rates.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum

Prediction (1 point)

· Head (only) OR (head with) no tail.

· Tail will be shorter than a cell with double-stranded breaks in DNA.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

Prediction (1 point)

· Head (only) OR (head with) no tail.

· Tail will be shorter than a cell with double-stranded breaks in DNA.

The student response earns one of the following points:

Prediction (1 point)

· Head (only) OR (head with) no tail.

· Tail will be shorter than a cell with double-stranded breaks in DNA.
